a.g: Ta, Ha.
We have not sent down to you the Qur'an that you be distressed
But only as a reminder for those who fear [Allah] -
A revelation from He who created the earth and highest heavens,
The Most Merciful [who is] above the Throne established.
To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth and what is between them and what is under the soil.
And if you speak aloud - then indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden.
Allah - there is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names.
And has the story of Moses reached you? -
When he saw a fire and said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire; perhaps I can bring you a torch or find at the fire some guidance."
And when he came to it, he was called, "O Moses,
Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وكما عقل قيام طلب التعلم وإرادته بذات الوالد للولد قبل أن يخلق ولده حتى إذا خلق ولده وعقل وخلق الله له علما متعلقا بما في قلب أبيه من الطلب صار مأمورا بذلك الطلب الذي قام بذات أبيه ودام وجوده إلى وقت معرفة ولده له فليعقل قيام الطلب الذي دل عليه قوله عز وجل اخلع نعليك بذات الله ومصير موسى عليه السلام مخاطبا به بعد وجوده إذ خلقت له معرفة بذلك الطلب وسمع لذلك الكلام القديم.
Indeed, just as you comprehend the establishment of the quest for knowledge [talab al-'ilm] and its intention within the very essence of the father for the child before his child is created—so that when his child is created, becomes rational, and God creates for him a knowledge [ma'rifa] pertaining to what is in the heart [qalb] of his father from that quest—he then becomes commanded by that quest which was established in the very essence of his father and whose existence continued until the time of his child's knowledge [ma'rifa] of it. So, comprehend the establishment of the quest which His word, Mighty and Majestic, indicated: "Take off your sandals," within the very essence of God, and the arrival of Moses, peace be upon him, being addressed by it after his existence, since a knowledge [ma'rifa] of that quest was created for him and he heard that Eternal Speech.

a.g: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed [to you].
Indeed, I am Allah. There is no deity except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وظاهر الأمر الوجوب والغفلة تضاد الذكر فمن غفل في جميع صلاته كيف يكون مقيما للصلاة لذكره. (فضيلة الخشوع) قال الله تعالى: ﴿ وأقم الصلاة لذكري ﴾ {طه: 14} وقال تعالى: ﴿ ولا تكن من الغافلين ﴾ {الأعراف: 205} وقال عز وجل: ﴿ لا تقربوا الصلاة وأنتم سكارى حتى تعلموا ما تقولون ﴾ {النساء: 43} قيل سكارى من كثرة الهم وقيل من حب الدنيا وقال وهب المراد به ظاهره ففيه تنبيه على سكر الدنيا إذ بين فيه العلة فقال: ﴿ حتى تعلموا ما تقولون ﴾ {النساء: 43} وكم من مصل لم يشرب خمرا وهو لا يعلم ما يقول في صلاته. وقال النبي ﭬ: (من صلى ركعتين لم يحدث نفسه فيهما بشيء من الدنيا غفر له ما تقدم من ذنبه[36]) وقال ﭬ إنما الصلاة تمسكن وتواضع وتضرع وتأوه وتنادم وتضع يديك فتقول اللهم اللهم فمن لم يفعل فهي خداج[37]) وروى عن الله سبحانه في الكتب السالفة أنه قال: ليس كل مصل أتقبل صلاته إنما أقبل صلاة من تواضع لعظمتي ولم يتكبر على عبادي وأطعم الفقير الجائع لوجهي. وقال ﭬ: (إنما فرضت الصلاة وأمر بالحج والطواف وأشعرت المناسك لإقامة ذكر الله تعالى فإذا لم يكن في قلبك للمذكور الذي هو المقصود والمبتغى عظمة ولا هيبة فما قيمة ذكرك[38]) وقال ﭬ للذي أوصاه: (وإذا صليت فصل صلاة مودع[39]) أي مودع لنفسه مودع لهواه مودع لعمره سائر إلى مولاه كما قال عز وجل: ﴿ أيها الإنسان إنك كادح إلى ربك كدحا فملاقيه ﴾ {الانشقاق: 6} وقال تعالى: ﴿ واتقوا الله ويعلمكم الله ﴾ {البقرة: 282} وقال تعالى: ﴿ واتقوا الله واعلموا أنكم ملاقوه ﴾ {البقرة: 223} وقال ﭬ: (من لم تنهه صلاته عن الفحشاء والمنكر لم يزدد من الله إلا بعدا[40]) والصلاة مناجاة فكيف تكون مع الغفلة.
Indeed, the apparent command necessitates obligation, and heedlessness [ghafla] opposes remembrance [dhikr]. So how can one who is heedless throughout all of his prayer be establishing the prayer for My remembrance? (The Virtue of Humility [khushu']) "Indeed, I am Allah. There is no deity except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance." (20:14) And He, the Exalted, said: "And do not be among the heedless [ghafilin]." (7:205) And He, the Mighty and Majestic, said: "Do not approach prayer while you are intoxicated [sukara] until you know what you are saying." (4:43) It is said: 'intoxicated from the multitude of concerns,' and it is said: 'from the love of the world [dunya].' And Wahb said: 'What is intended is its apparent meaning.' So in it is an alert to the intoxication of the world [dunya], for He stated the reason within it, saying: "until you know what you are saying." (4:43) And how many a person praying [musalli] has not drunk wine, yet he does not know what he is saying in his prayer! And the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever prays two units [rak'atayn] without conversing with himself therein about anything of the world [dunya], his preceding sins are forgiven for him." And he, peace be upon him, said: "Verily, prayer [salah] is restraint, humility, supplication, sighing, remorse, and placing your hands [in supplication] while you say: 'O Allah, O Allah.' So whoever does not do that, then it is deficient." And it is narrated from Allah, glorified is He, in the previous scriptures that He said: 'I do not accept the prayer [salah] of every person praying [musalli]. I only accept the prayer [salah] of one who humbles himself before My majesty, does not act arrogantly over My servants, and feeds the hungry poor for the sake of My Face.' And he, peace be upon him, said: "Prayer [salah] was only prescribed, and the Hajj, circumambulation [tawaf], and the rites [manasik] were commanded, for the establishment of the remembrance [dhikr] of Allah, the Exalted. So if there is not in your heart [qalb] for the One Remembered [madhkur], who is the intended goal and objective, any majesty or awe, then what is the value of your remembrance [dhikr]?" And he, peace be upon him, said to the one he advised: "And when you pray, pray the prayer [salah] of one bidding farewell." Meaning, bidding farewell to his soul [nafs], bidding farewell to his desire [hawa], bidding farewell to his lifespan, journeying to his Master, as He, the Mighty and Majestic, said: "O mankind, indeed you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion and will meet Him." (84:6) And He, the Exalted, said: "And fear Allah; and Allah teaches you." (2:282) And He, the Exalted, said: "And fear Allah and know that you will meet Him." (2:223) And he, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever is not prevented by his prayer [salah] from immorality and wrongdoing, he only increases in distance from Allah." And prayer [salah] is a confidential discourse [munajat]; so how can it be with heedlessness [ghafla]?

a.g: Indeed, the Hour is coming - I almost conceal it - so that every soul may be recompensed according to that for which it strives.
So do not let one avert you from it who does not believe in it and follows his desire, for you [then] would perish.
And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?"
He said, "It is my staff; I lean upon it, and I bring down leaves for my sheep and I have therein other uses."
[Allah] said, "Throw it down, O Moses."
So he threw it down, and thereupon it was a snake, moving swiftly.
[Allah] said, "Seize it and fear not; We will return it to its former condition.
And draw in your hand to your side; it will come out white without disease - another sign,
That We may show you [some] of Our greater signs.
Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
والذي يدعو إلى مجاهدة القلب القاسي فيقول قال الله عز وجل ﴿ إذهب إلى فرعون إنه طغى ﴾ ويشير إلى قلبه ويومئ إلى أنه المراد بفرعون وهذا الجنس قد يستعمله بعض الوعاظ في المقاصد الصحيحة تحسينا للكلام وترغيبا للمستمع وهو ممنوع وقد تستعمله الباطنية في المقاصد الفاسدة لتغرير الناس ودعوتهم إلى مذهبهم الباطل فينزلون القرآن على وفق رأيهم ومذهبهم على أمور يعلمون قطعا أنها غير مرادة به
Indeed, go to Pharaoh [Fir'awn], for he has transgressed. And that which calls to striving against the hard heart [qalb], so it is said: Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, said, "Go to Pharaoh, for he has transgressed," and he points to his own heart and signals that it is what is intended by 'Pharaoh'. And this type, some preachers may use it for sound purposes, to beautify the speech and to entice the listener, and it is forbidden. And the Batiniyya may use it for corrupt purposes, to deceive the people and call them to their false doctrine, for they interpret the Quran according to their own opinion and doctrine regarding matters which they know with certainty are not intended by it.

a.g: [Moses] said, "My Lord, expand for me my breast [with assurance]
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
رب اشرح لي صدري ويسر لي أمري ﴾ {} وتقول عند النظر إلى السماء ﴿ ربنا ما خلقت هذا باطلا سبحانك فقنا عذاب النار ﴾ {} ﴿ تبارك الذي جعل في السماء بروجا وجعل فيها سراجا وقمرا منيرا ﴾ {}
Indeed, expand for me my breast [sadri] and ease for me my affair [amri]. And you say when gazing at the sky: "Our Lord, You have not created this in vain. Glory be to You! So protect us from the punishment of the Fire." "Blessed is He Who placed in the sky constellations and placed therein a lamp [sirajan] and a luminous moon [qamaran muniran]."

a.g: And ease for me my task
And untie the knot from my tongue
That they may understand my speech.
And appoint for me a minister from my family -
Aaron, my brother.
Increase through him my strength
And let him share my task
That we may exalt You much
And remember You much.
Indeed, You are of us ever Seeing."
[Allah] said, "You have been granted your request, O Moses.
And We had already conferred favor upon you another time,
When We inspired to your mother what We inspired,

[Saying], 'Cast him into the chest and cast it into the river, and the river will throw it onto the bank; there will take him an enemy to Me and an enemy to him.' And I bestowed upon you love from Me that you would be brought up under My eye.

[And We favored you] when your sister went and said, 'Shall I direct you to someone who will be responsible for him?' So We restored you to your mother that she might be content and not grieve. And you killed someone, but We saved you from retaliation and tried you with a [severe] trial. And you remained [some] years among the people of Madyan. Then you came [here] at the decreed time, O Moses.
And I produced you for Myself.
Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not slacken in My remembrance.
Go, both of you, to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
And speak to him with gentle speech that perhaps he may be reminded or fear [Allah]."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وَدَلَّ عَلَى وُجُوبِ الرِّفْقِ مَا اسْتَدَلَّ بِهِ الْمَأْمُونُ إِذَا وَعَظَهُ وَاعِظٌ وَعَنَّفَ لَهُ فِي الْقَوْلِ فَقَالَ: يَا رَجُلُ ارْفُقْ فَقَدْ بَعَثَ اللَّهُ مَنْ هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِنْكَ إِلَى مَنْ هُوَ شَرٌّ مِنِّي وَأَمَرَهُ بِالرِّفْقِ فَقَالَ تَعَالَى: فَقُولَا لَهُ قَوْلًا لَيِّنًا لَعَلَّهُ يَتَذَكَّرُ أَوْ يَخْشَى فَلْيَكُنِ اقْتِدَاءُ الْمُحْتَسِبِ فِي الرِّفْقِ بِالْأَنْبِيَاءِ صَلَوَاتُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِمْ.
And the evidence for the obligation of gentleness [al-rifq] is what al-Ma'mun cited as proof when an admonisher admonished him and was harsh with him in speech, so he said: "O man, be gentle! For indeed, Allah sent one who is better than you to one who is worse than me, and commanded him to gentleness [al-rifq]. So the Exalted said: 'And speak to him a gentle word [qawlan layyinan]; perhaps he may remember or fear.'" So let the one who enjoins good [al-muhtasib] take as his example in gentleness [al-rifq] the Prophets, the prayers of Allah be upon them.

a.g: They said, "Our Lord, indeed we are afraid that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقوله: " إننا نخاف أن يفرط علينا أو أن يطغى " وهذا من غير موسى عليه السلام من سوء الأدب لأن الذي أقيم مقام الأنس يلاطف ويحتمل، ولم يحتمل ليونس عليه السلام ما دون هذا لما أقيم مقام القبض والهيبة، فعوقب بالسجن في بطن الحوت - في ظلمات ثلاث - ونودي عليه إلى يوم القيامة " لولا أن تداركه نعمة من ربه لنبذ بالعراء وهو مذموم ".
Indeed, "We fear that he will hasten against us or transgress" [Quran 20:45]. And this, from other than Musa, peace be upon him, is from bad conduct [su' al-adab], for the one who is established in the station of intimacy [maqam al-uns] is to be treated gently and is to be borne with. And Yunus, peace be upon him, was not borne with for less than this, for he was established in the station of constriction [maqam al-qabd] and awe [al-haybah]. Thus, he was punished with imprisonment in the belly of the whale—in three darknesses—and was called out to until the Day of Resurrection: "Had it not been that a favor from his Lord reached him, he would have been cast upon the barren shore, blameworthy" [Quran 68:49].

a.g: [Allah] said, "Fear not. Indeed, I am with you both; I hear and I see.

So go to him and say, 'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not torment them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And peace will be upon he who follows the guidance.
Indeed, it has been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies and turns away.' "
[Pharaoh] said, "So who is the Lord of you two, O Moses?"
He said, "Our Lord is He who gave each thing its form and then guided [it]."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فأما الهداية فلا سبيل لأحد إلى طلب السعادة إلا بها لأن داعية الإنسان قد تكون مائلة إلى ما فيه صلاح آخرته ولكن إذا لم يعلم ما فيه صلاح آخرته حتى يظن الفساد صلاحا فمن أين ينفعه مجرد الإرادة فلا فائدة في الإرادة والقدرة والأسباب إلا بعد الهداية ولذلك قال تعالى: ﴿ ربنا الذى أعطى كل شىء خلقه ثم هدى ﴾
Indeed, as for guidance [hidaya], there is no way for anyone to seek felicity [sa'ada] except through it. For the desire [dā'iya] of a human may be inclined towards what contains rectitude [ṣalāḥ] for his Hereafter [ākhira]. But if he does not know what contains rectitude for his Hereafter, to the point that he deems corruption [fasād] to be rectitude, then from where will mere will [irāda] benefit him? So there is no benefit in will, capability [qudra], and means [asbāb] except after guidance [hidaya]. And for that reason, the Most High said: "Our Lord is He who gave everything its creation [khalq], then guided [hada]."

a.g: [Pharaoh] said, "Then what is the case of the former generations?"
[Moses] said, "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."
[It is He] who has made for you the earth as a bed [spread out] and inserted therein for you roadways and sent down from the sky, rain and produced thereby categories of various plants.
Eat [therefrom] and pasture your livestock. Indeed, in that are signs for those of intelligence.
From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will extract you another time.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فإذا صعد بروحه نبذ وقيل أي رب عبدك فلان لم تقبله سماء ولا أرض فيقول الله عز وجل ارجعوه فأروه ما أعددت له من الشر إني وعدته ﴿ منها خلقناكم وفيها نعيدكم ومنها نخرجكم تارة أخرى ﴾ {}الآية وأنه ليسمع خفق نعالهم إذا ولوا مدبرين حتى يقال له يا هذا من ربك ومن نبيك وما دينك
Indeed, when his spirit ascends, it is cast out, and it is said: "O Lord, Your servant so-and-so, neither the heavens nor the earth accepted him." So Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, says: "Return him, and show him what I have prepared for him of evil. Indeed, I promised him, **'From it [the earth] We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will bring you out another time'** (Qur'an 20:55)." And verily, he hears the shuffling of their sandals when they turn away, retreating, until it is said to him: "O you, who is your Lord, who is your Prophet, and what is your religion?"

a.g: And We certainly showed Pharaoh Our signs - all of them - but he denied and refused.
He said, "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?
Then we will surely bring you magic like it, so make between us and you an appointment, which we will not fail to keep and neither will you, in a place assigned."
[Moses] said, "Your appointment is on the day of the festival when the people assemble at mid-morning."
So Pharaoh went away, put together his plan, and then came [to Moses].
Moses said to the magicians summoned by Pharaoh, "Woe to you! Do not invent a lie against Allah or He will exterminate you with a punishment; and he has failed who invents [such falsehood]."
So they disputed over their affair among themselves and concealed their private conversation.
They said, "Indeed, these are two magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic and do away with your most exemplary way.
So resolve upon your plan and then come [forward] in line. And he has succeeded today who overcomes."
They said, "O Moses, either you throw or we will be the first to throw."
He said, "Rather, you throw." And suddenly their ropes and staffs seemed to him from their magic that they were moving [like snakes].
And he sensed within himself apprehension, did Moses.
Allah said, "Fear not. Indeed, it is you who are superior.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومع هذا لما ألقى السحرة سحرهم أوجس موسى في نفسه خيفة إذا لم يأمن مكر الله والتبس الأمر عليه حتى جدد عليه الأمن وقيل له ﴿ لا تخف إنك أنت الأعلى ﴾ {}
Indeed, and despite this, when the magicians cast their magic, Moses felt fear [khawf] in his soul [nafs], for he was not secure from the guile of God, and the matter became confused for him, until security [amn] was renewed for him and it was said to him: "Fear not, indeed you are the highest."

a.g: And throw what is in your right hand; it will swallow up what they have crafted. What they have crafted is but the trick of a magician, and the magician will not succeed wherever he is."
So the magicians fell down in prostration. They said, "We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."

[Pharaoh] said, "You believed him before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will surely know which of us is more severe in [giving] punishment and more enduring."
They said, "Never will we prefer you over what has come to us of clear proofs and [over] He who created us. So decree whatever you are to decree. You can only decree for this worldly life.
Indeed, we have believed in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and what you compelled us [to do] of magic. And Allah is better and more enduring."
Indeed, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal - indeed, for him is Hell; he will neither die therein nor live.
But whoever comes to Him as a believer having done righteous deeds - for those will be the highest degrees [in position]:
Gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of one who purifies himself.
And We had inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants and strike for them a dry path through the sea; you will not fear being overtaken [by Pharaoh] nor be afraid [of drowning]."
So Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers, and there covered them from the sea that which covered them,
And Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide [them].
O Children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy, and We made an appointment with you at the right side of the mount, and We sent down to you manna and quails,

[Saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you and do not transgress [or oppress others] therein, lest My anger should descend upon you. And he upon whom My anger descends has certainly fallen."
But indeed, I am the Perpetual Forgiver of whoever repents and believes and does righteousness and then continues in guidance.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولو لم يكن فيه إلا قوله تعالى: ﴿ وإني لغفار لمن تاب وآمن وعمل صالحا ثم اهتدى ﴾ لكان كافيا إذ علق المغفرة على أربعة شروط يعجز العبد عن آحادها
Indeed, and if there were in it nothing but His saying, the Most High: **"And indeed, I am Forgiving [ghaffār] to whoever repents [tāba] and believes [āmana] and does righteous work [ʿamila ṣāliḥan] and then remains guided [ih'tadā]."** — it would have been sufficient, for He has made forgiveness [maghfira] contingent upon four conditions [shurūṭ] which the servant [ʿabd] is incapable of fulfilling even individually.

a.g: [Allah] said, "And what made you hasten from your people, O Moses?"
He said, "They are close upon my tracks, and I hastened to You, my Lord, that You be pleased."
[Allah] said, "But indeed, We have tried your people after you [departed], and the Samiri has led them astray."

So Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved. He said, "O my people, did your Lord not make you a good promise? Then, was the time [of its fulfillment] too long for you, or did you wish that wrath from your Lord descend upon you, so you broke your promise [of obedience] to me?"

They said, "We did not break our promise to you by our will, but we were made to carry burdens from the ornaments of the people [of Pharaoh], so we threw them [into the fire], and thus did the Samiri throw."
And he extracted for them [the statue of] a calf which had a lowing sound, and they said, "This is your god and the god of Moses, but he forgot."
Did they not see that it could not return to them any speech and that it did not possess for them any harm or benefit?
And Aaron had already told them before [the return of Moses], "O my people, you are only being tested by it, and indeed, your Lord is the Most Merciful, so follow me and obey my order."
They said, "We will never cease being devoted to the calf until Moses returns to us."
[Moses] said, "O Aaron, what prevented you, when you saw them going astray,
From following me? Then have you disobeyed my order?"

[Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, do not seize [me] by my beard or by my head. Indeed, I feared that you would say, 'You caused division among the Children of Israel, and you did not observe [or await] my word.' "
[Moses] said, "And what is your case, O Samiri?"
He said, "I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful [of dust] from the track of the messenger and threw it, and thus did my soul entice me."

[Moses] said, "Then go. And indeed, it is [decreed] for you in [this] life to say, 'No contact.' And indeed, you have an appointment [in the Hereafter] you will not fail to keep. And look at your 'god' to which you remained devoted. We will surely burn it and blow it into the sea with a blast.
Your god is only Allah, except for whom there is no deity. He has encompassed all things in knowledge."
Thus, [O Muhammad], We relate to you from the news of what has preceded. And We have certainly given you from Us the Qur'an.
Whoever turns away from it - then indeed, he will bear on the Day of Resurrection a burden,
[Abiding] eternally therein, and evil it is for them on the Day of Resurrection as a load -
The Day the Horn will be blown. And We will gather the criminals, that Day, blue-eyed.
They will murmur among themselves, "You remained not but ten [days in the world]."
We are most knowing of what they say when the best of them in manner will say, "You remained not but one day."
And they ask you about the mountains, so say, "My Lord will blow them away with a blast.
And He will leave the earth a level plain;
You will not see therein a depression or an elevation."
That Day, everyone will follow [the call of] the Caller [with] no deviation therefrom, and [all] voices will be stilled before the Most Merciful, so you will not hear except a whisper [of footsteps].
That Day, no intercession will benefit except [that of] one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission and has accepted his word.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
حتى يشفع نبينا ﷺ لمن يؤذن له فيه ﴿ لا يملكون الشفاعة إلا من أذن له الرحمن ورضى له قولا ﴾ فتأمل في طول هذا اليوم وشدة الانتظار فيه حتى يخف عليك انتظار الصبر عن المعاصى في عمرك المختصر.
Indeed, until our Prophet ﷺ intercedes for the one who is granted permission therein: "They possess not intercession [shafa'a] save for him to whom the All-Merciful [al-Rahman] grants permission and is pleased with his speech." So contemplate the length of that Day and the severity of the waiting within it, so that the waiting of patience [sabr] from sins in your brief lifespan may become light upon you.

a.g: Allah knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, but they do not encompass it in knowledge.
And [all] faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. And he will have failed who carries injustice.
But he who does of righteous deeds while he is a believer - he will neither fear injustice nor deprivation.
And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an and have diversified therein the warnings that perhaps they will avoid [sin] or it would cause them remembrance.

So high [above all] is Allah, the Sovereign, the Truth. And, [O Muhammad], do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur'an before its revelation is completed to you, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال لنبيه صلى الله عليه وسلم ولا تعجل بالقرآن من قبل أن يقضي إليك وحيه وهذا لأن الأعمال ينبغي أن تكون بعد التبصرة والمعرفة والتبصرة تحتاج إلى تأمل وتمهل والعجلة تمنع من ذلك وعند الاستعجال يروج الشيطان شره على الإنسان من حيث لا يدري
Indeed, and He said to His Prophet, peace be upon him: "And be not in haste with the Qur'an before its revelation to you is completed." This is because actions [a'mal] should come after clear insight [tabsira] and knowledge [ma'rifa], and clear insight [tabsira] requires contemplation [ta'ammul] and deliberation [tamahhul]. Haste [ajala] prevents that, and with haste [isti'jal], Satan [shaytan] introduces his evil [sharr] upon a person from where he does not perceive.

a.g: And We had already taken a promise from Adam before, but he forgot; and We found not in him determination.
And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except Iblees; he refused.
So We said, "O Adam, indeed this is an enemy to you and to your wife. Then let him not remove you from Paradise so you would suffer.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولم يؤمنهم ذلك من كيد الشيطان ولذلك لم يسلم منه آدم وحواء في الجنة التي هي دار الأمن والسرور بعد أن قال الله لهما "إن هذا عدو لك ولزوجك فلا يخرجنكما من الجنة فتشقى إن لك أن لا تجوع فيها ولا تعرى وأنك لا تظمأ فيها ولا تضحى" ومع أنه لم ينه إلا عن شجرة واحدة وأطلق له وراء ذلك ما أراد فإذا لم يأمن نبي من الأنبياء وهو في الجنة دار الأمن والسعادة من كيد الشيطان فكيف يجوز لغيره أن يأمن في دار الدنيا وهي منبع المحن والفتن معدن الملاذ والشهوات المنهي عنها؟
Indeed, that did not secure them [āmanahum] from the guile of Satan [kayd al-shayṭān]. And for that reason, Adam and Eve were not safe from him in the Garden [al-jannah], which is the abode of security [al-amn] and delight, even after God said to them, "Indeed, this is an enemy to you and your wife. So let him not drive you both out of the Garden, lest you be wretched. Indeed, it is for you that you shall not be hungry therein nor naked, and that you shall not be thirsty therein nor suffer from heat." And despite the fact that He only forbade a single tree, and permitted for him beyond that whatever he desired, if a prophet from among the prophets was not secure [lam ya'man] while in the Garden—the abode of security [al-amn] and felicity—from the guile of Satan [kayd al-shayṭān], then how can it be permissible for anyone else to feel secure [an ya'man] in the abode of this world [dār al-dunyā], which is the source of trials and tribulations, the mine of forbidden pleasures and desires [al-shahawāt]?

a.g: Indeed, it is [promised] for you not to be hungry therein or be unclothed.
And indeed, you will not be thirsty therein or be hot from the sun."
Then Satan whispered to him; he said, "O Adam, shall I direct you to the tree of eternity and possession that will not deteriorate?"
And Adam and his wife ate of it, and their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And Adam disobeyed his Lord and erred.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فجميع قصص القرآن تنبيهات لأولي البصائر والأبصار حتى ينظروا إليها بعين الاعتبار، فإنما هي عند ذوي الاعتبار من الأسماء. فأول القصص: قصة آدم عليه السلام وإبليس أما تراهما كيف اشتركا في اسم المعصية والمخالفة ثم تباينا في الاجتباء والعصمة. أما إبليس فأبلس عن رحمته، وقيل إنه من المبعدين. وأما آدم عليه السلام فقيل فيه " وعصى آدم ربه فغوى ثم اجتباه ربه فتاب عليه وهدى ".
Indeed, all the stories [qisas] of the Quran are awakenings for the people of insight [ulu al-basa'ir] and vision, so that they may look upon them with the eye of contemplation [i'tibar], for they are, in the view of the people of contemplation, from the signs [ayat]. So the first of the stories: the story of Adam, peace be upon him, and Iblis. Do you not see how they both shared in the name of disobedience [ma'siyah] and opposition, then they diverged in being chosen [ijtiba'] and protection [ismah]. As for Iblis, he was cut off from His mercy, and it is said he is among the banished. And as for Adam, peace be upon him, it was said concerning him: "And Adam disobeyed his Lord and went astray. Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided him."

a.g: Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided [him].

[Allah] said, "Descend from Paradise - all, [your descendants] being enemies to one another. And if there should come to you guidance from Me - then whoever follows My guidance will neither go astray [in the world] nor suffer [in the Hereafter].
And whoever turns away from My remembrance - indeed, he will have a depressed life, and We will gather him on the Day of Resurrection blind."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال أبو هريرة قال النبي ﭬ: (المؤمن في قبره في روضة خضراء ويرحب له في قبره سبعون ذراعا ويضىء حتى يكون كالقمر ليلة البدر هل تدرون فيماذا أنزلت ﴿ فإن له معيشة ضنكا ﴾ {} قالوا الله ورسوله أعلم قال عذاب الكافر في قبره يسلط عليه تسعة وتسعون تنينا هل تدرون ما التنين؟ تسعة وتسعون حية لكل حية تسعة رؤوس يخدشونه ويلحسونه وينفخون في جسمه إلى يوم يبعثون ولا ينبغي أن يتعجب من هذا العدد على الخصوص فإن أعداد هذه الحيات والعقارب بعدد الأخلاق المذمومة من الكبر والرياء والحسد والغل والحقد وسائر الصفات فإن لها أصولا معدودة ثم تتشعب منها فروع معدودة ثم تنقسم فروعها إلى أقسام وتلك الصفات بأعيانها هي المهلكات وهي بأعيانها تنقلب عقارب وحيات فالقوي منها يلدغ لدغ التنين والضعيف يلدغ لدغ العقرب وما بينهما يؤذي إيذاء الحية وأرباب القلوب والبصائر يشاهدون بنور البصيرة هذه المهلكات والشعاب فروعها إلا أن مقدار عددها لا يوقف عليه إلا بنور النبوة، فأمثال هذه الأخبار لها ظواهر صحيحة وأسرار خفية ولكنها عند أرباب البصائر واضحة فمن لم تنكشف له حقائقها فلا ينبغي أن ينكر ظواهرها بل أقل درجات الإيمان التصديق والتسليم. فإن قلت: فنحن نشاهد الكافر في قبره مدة ونراقبه ولا نشاهد شيئا من ذلك فما وجه التصديق على خلاف المشاهدة؟ فأعلم أن لك ثلاث مقامات في التصديق بأمثال هذا [أحدها] وهو الأظهر والأصح والأسلم أن تصدق بأنها موجودة وهي تلدغ الميت ولكنك لا تشاهد ذلك فإن هذه العين لا تصلح لمشاهدة الأمور الملكوتية وكل ما يتعلق بالآخرة فهو من علم الملكوت أما ترى الصحابة رضي الله عنهم كيف كانوا يؤمنون بنزول جبريل وما كانوا يشاهدونه ويؤمنون بأنه عليه السلام يشاهده فإن كنت لا تؤمن بهذا فتصحيح أصل الإيمان بالملائكة والوحي أهم عليك وإن كنت آمنت به وجوزت أن يشاهد النبي مالا تشاهده الأمة فكيف لا تجوز هذا في الميت وكما أن الملك لا يشبه الآدميين والحيوانات فالحيات والعقارب التي تلدغ في القبر ليست من جنس حيات عالمنا بل هي جنس آخر وتدرك بحاسة أخرى.
Indeed, the believer [mu'min] in his grave is in a verdant meadow, and his grave is widened for him seventy cubits, and it is illuminated until it is like the full moon. Do you know upon whom was revealed, "Then for him is a life of hardship [ma'ishatan dankan]"? They said, "God and His Messenger know best." He said: The punishment of the disbeliever [kafir] in his grave; ninety-nine dragons [tinnin] are set upon him. Do you know what the dragon is? Ninety-nine serpents, each serpent has nine heads; they scratch him, lick him, and blow into his body until the Day they are resurrected. And one should not be astonished at this number in particular, for the numbers of these serpents and scorpions are according to the number of blameworthy character traits [akhlaq al-madhmuma] from arrogance [kibr], ostentation [riya'], envy [hasad], rancor [ghill], malice [hiqd], and all other attributes. For they have countable roots, then from them branch out countable branches, then their branches divide into divisions. And those attributes in their very essences are the destroyers [muhlikat], and they in their very essences transform into scorpions and serpents. The strong among them stings with the sting of the dragon, and the weak stings with the sting of the scorpion, and what is between them harms with the harm of the serpent. And the possessors of hearts [arbab al-qulub] and insight [basair] witness by the light of insight [nur al-basira] these destroyers and their branching offshoots, except that the measure of their number is not known except by the light of prophethood [nur al-nubuwwa]. So the likes of these reports have sound outward meanings [zawahir sahiha] and hidden secrets [asrar khafiya], but they are clear to the possessors of insight. So whoever the realities [haqa'iq] of them are not unveiled for, he should not deny their outward meanings. Rather, the lowest degree of faith [iman] is belief [tasdiq] and submission [taslim]. If you say: "But we observe the disbeliever in his grave for a period and watch him, and we do not witness any of that. So what is the basis for belief contrary to observation?" Then know that you have three stations [maqamat] in believing the likes of this. [The first of them]—and it is the most apparent, the most correct, and the safest—is that you believe they exist and they sting the deceased, but you do not witness that. For this eye is not fit to witness the matters of the unseen realm [umur al-malakut], and everything pertaining to the Hereafter [al-akhira] is from the knowledge of the unseen realm [ilm al-malakut]. Do you not see how the Companions, may God be pleased with them, used to believe in the descent of Gabriel, and they did not witness him, and they believed that the Prophet, peace be upon him, witnessed him? So if you do not believe in this, then correcting the foundation of faith [asl al-iman] in the angels and revelation is more important for you. And if you have believed in it and deemed it possible for the Prophet to witness what the community does not witness, then how can you not deem this possible for the deceased? And just as the angel does not resemble humans and animals, so the serpents and scorpions that sting in the grave are not of the kind of the serpents of our world; rather, they are another kind, perceived by another sense.

a.g: He will say, "My Lord, why have you raised me blind while I was [once] seeing?"
[Allah] will say, "Thus did Our signs come to you, and you forgot them; and thus will you this Day be forgotten."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وبقوله عز وجل ﴿ كذلك أتتك آياتنا فنسيتها وكذلك اليوم تنسى ﴾ {} أي تركتهما ولم تنظر إليها ولم تعبأ بها فإنَّ المُقَصِّر في الأمر يقال إنه نسي الأمر وتلاوة القرآن حق تلاوته هو أن يشترك فيه اللسان والعقل والقلب فحظ اللسان تصحيح الحروف بالترتيل وحظ العقل تفسير المعاني وحظ القلب الاتعاظ والتأثر بالانزجار والائتمار فاللسان يرتل والعقل يترجم والقلب يتعظ وأما مجَرَّد حركة اللسان فقليل الجدوى بل التالي باللسان المعرض عن العمل جدير بأن يكون هو المراد بقوله تعالى ﴿ كذلك أتتك آياتنا فنسيتها وكذلك اليوم تنسى ﴾ {} أي تركتها ولم تنظر إليها ولم تعبأ بها فإنَّ المُقَصِّر في الأمر يقال إنه نسي الأمر.
Indeed, as He, the Almighty, has said: **"Thus did Our signs come to you, and you forgot them; and thus today you are forgotten."** That is, you abandoned them and did not look upon them, nor did you pay them any heed, for the one who is negligent in a matter is said to have forgotten the matter. And the true recitation [tilawa] of the Qur'an is that the tongue [lisan], the intellect ['aql], and the heart [qalb] all partake in it. The portion of the tongue is the correct pronunciation of the letters with measured recitation [tartil]; the portion of the intellect is the interpretation of the meanings; and the portion of the heart is to take admonition [i'tizaz] and to be affected by the warning and the command. So the tongue recites melodiously, the intellect translates, and the heart takes admonition. As for the mere movement of the tongue, its benefit is little. Rather, the one who recites with the tongue while turning away from acting upon it is worthy of being the one intended by His saying, the Exalted: **"Thus did Our signs come to you, and you forgot them; and thus today you are forgotten."** That is, you abandoned them and did not look upon them, nor did you pay them any heed, for the one who is negligent in a matter is said to have forgotten the matter.

a.g: And thus do We recompense he who transgressed and did not believe in the signs of his Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more enduring.
Then, has it not become clear to them how many generations We destroyed before them as they walk among their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs for those of intelligence.
And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, punishment would have been an obligation [due immediately], and [if not for] a specified term [decreed].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومنها المقدم والمؤخر وهو مظنة الغلط كقوله عز وجل ﴿ ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك لكان لزاما وأجل مسمى ﴾ {} معناه لولا الكلمة وأجل مسمى لكان لزاما ولولاه لكان نصبا كاللزام
Indeed, from them is the advanced and the deferred, and it is a place of potential error, as in His Mighty and Majestic saying: "And if not for a word [kalimah] that had preceded from your Lord, it would have been an inevitability [lazaman] and a term appointed [ajalan musamman]." Its meaning is: If not for the word [kalimah] and the appointed term [ajalan musamman], it would have been an inevitability [lazaman]; and if not for it, it would have been a punishment [nasaban] like the inevitability [lizam].

a.g: So be patient over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and during periods of the night [exalt Him] and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ثم قرأ ﴿ وسبح بحمد ربك قبل طلوع الشمس وقبل غروبها ﴾ وهو مخرج فى الصحيحين
Then recite: "And glorify [sabbih] with the praise [hamd] of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting." And this is reported in the two Sahihs.

a.g: And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] categories of them, [its being but] the splendor of worldly life by which We test them. And the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
SKIPPED_NOT_FOUND
And it is narrated that he, peace and blessings of God be upon him, passed by his companions while there were ten pregnant she-camels [al-'ishar], and they were among the most beloved of their possessions to them and the most precious in their sight, because they combine transportation, meat, milk, and wool. And due to their greatness in their hearts [qulub], God the Exalted said: "And when the ten-month pregnant camels are neglected..." He said: So the Messenger of God, peace and blessings of God the Exalted be upon him, turned away from them and lowered his gaze. So it was said to him: "O Messenger of God, these are the most precious of our possessions, why do you not look at them?" He said: "God has indeed forbidden me from that." Then he recited His Exalted's saying: "And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment..." the verse. And from Abu Rafi' that he said: A guest came to the Messenger of God, peace and blessings of God be upon him, and he did not find with him what would be suitable for him. So he sent me to a man from the Jews of Khaybar and said: "Say to him: Muhammad says to you: Lend me or sell me some flour until the crescent of Rajab." He said: So I came to him and he said: "No, by God, except with a pledge." So I informed the Messenger of God, peace and blessings of God be upon him, of that, and he said: "By God, I am indeed trustworthy [amin] with the people of the heaven, trustworthy [amin] with the people of the earth. And if he sold to me or lent to me, I would have fulfilled it to him. Go with this coat of mail of mine to him and pledge it to him." And when I went out, this verse was revealed: "And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to groups of them, as the glitter of the life of the world [zahrat al-hayat al-dunya]..." the verse. And this verse is a consolation [ta'ziyah] for the Messenger of God, peace and blessings of God be upon him, from the world [al-dunya].

a.g: And enjoin prayer upon your family [and people] and be steadfast therein. We ask you not for provision; We provide for you, and the [best] outcome is for [those of] righteousness.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال صلى الله تعالى عليه وسلم: " من انقطع إلى الله عز وجل كفاه الله تعالى كل مؤنة ورزقه من حيث لا يحتسب، ومن انقطع إلى الدنيا وكله الله إليها". ويروى عن رسول الله صلى الله تعالى عليه وسلم أنه كان إذا أصاب أهله خصاصة قال: "قوموا إلى الصلاة " ويقول: " بهذا أمرني ربي عز وجل قال عز وجل: " وأمر أهلك بالصلاة واصطبر عليها " الآية.
Indeed, He—may He be exalted—said: "Whoever cuts himself off [inqata'a] to Allah—glory be to Him—Allah suffices him for every need [mu'nah] and provides for him [yarzuquhu] from where he does not reckon. And whoever cuts himself off to the world [dunya], Allah entrusts him to it." And it is narrated from the Messenger of Allah—may Allah bless him and grant him peace—that when poverty [khasasah] befell his family, he would say: "Arise to the prayer [salah]," and he would say: "With this my Lord—glory be to Him—commanded me, for He—glory be to Him—said: 'And enjoin prayer upon your family and be steadfast in it...'" the verse.

a.g: And they say, "Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?" Has there not come to them evidence of what was in the former scriptures?

And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before him, they would have said, "Our Lord, why did You not send to us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses before we were humiliated and disgraced?"
Say, "Each [of us] is waiting; so wait. For you will know who are the companions of the sound path and who is guided."
